pr_title: support a non-default MySQL database port in 'mysqladmin ping` command

timeline.message: support a non-default MySQL database port in 'mysqladmin ping` command

timeline.bodyText:
Thanks so much for your contribution @dtenenba !
It might be nice to handle one more corner case here. It is possible the db_host does not contain a port (the : part). Could you maybe separate this out to a variable $db_port that's set to 3306 in case localhost does not contain :?
timeline.author: inodb

replies.bodyText: The localdb test might actually be failing correctly in this case, because the test doesn't have a : in the hostname: https://github.com/cBioPortal/cbioportal-frontend/blob/master/end-to-end-test/local/runtime-config/portal.properties#L5. There are two or so tests in the localdb test suite that are failing in the master branch, so those can be ignored
replies.author: inodb

timeline.message:
use existing value of $db_port or calculate value if not set

- if db_host contains a ':', set db_port to what's after the ':'
- otherwise set it to default mysql port number (3306)
